result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale N. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: GFE to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school.

supervisions.notes:
Any vehicle titled or registered in defendant's names is subject to IID as if the defendant himself, and device to be installed.
Half Priced IID

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
for Half Priced IID

Case Called: 8:30am. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher.  Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Julie Sawyer. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed.   PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 1 (OWI-5th). Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Statements by State & Atty Sawyer. Defendant makes statement. COURT ORDERS: WI State Prison Total of 2 yrs; Initial Confinement 1 yr; Extended Supervision 1 yr. 56 days time served. Sentence concurrent to 12CF522. $2,284.00 inclusive cc; Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 3 years, as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed; $50 IID installation fee to be paid; Crt orders 1/2 Price IID; 3 yrs dl revocation; AODA; Drivers Safety Drivers Program; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; Absolute Sobriety. Eligible for Substance Abuse Program and not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. Crt advises and defendant signs Ineligible Voting Form. Copy of CR 234 given to Defendant after Court. COURT advises and orders Defendant to provide DNA Sample pursuant to WI Statute 165.76. Clerk gives copy of DNA Expungement information to Defendant pursuant to WI Statute 165.77. Court remands Defendant to Marathon Cty Sheriff to be transported to Dodge Correctional. Copy of CR 234 given to Defendant after Court. State moves to find refusal lawful and dismiss 15TR751. No objection by Atty Sawyer. COURT deems refusal lawful and dismisses. Adjourned: 8:43am.
Plea hearing on April 3, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Plea set
Pre-trial conference on March 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
and Demand for Discovery & Inspection
Defendants
Probable Cause Found
of Preliminary Examination
Julie Sawyer
